content:
From: Lawrence Paulson <lp15@cam.ac.uk>
Iâ€™m happy to announce yet another contribution by the ever-prolific Manuel Eberl: The Sum-of-Squares Function and Jacobi's Two-Square Theorem. He defines the sum-of-squares function r_k(n), which counts the number of ways to write a natural number n as a sum of k squares of integers. Signs and permutations of these integers are taken into account. He then formalises the main result: Jacobi's two-square theorem.

https://www.isa-afp.org/entries/Sum_Of_Squares_Count.html

Larry Paulson
